cyclone.name: FAY
cyclone.current_location: about 40 miles ENE of Cape Hatteras, North Carolina
cyclone.trajectory: moving north to north-northeast just offshore of the Mid-Atlantic states toward southern New Jersey and the New York Bight
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the southern New Jersey coast (around Cape May/Ocean City)

weather_observation.watch_coast: None in effect south of Cape May, NJ
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning from Cape May, NJ to Watch Hill, RI including Long Island and Long Island Sound
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Outer Banks of North Carolina northward through the Delmarva Peninsula, Chesapeake Bay mouth, New Jersey, Long Island and southern New England
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds possible Friday with sustained 25–35 mph and gusts 40–50 mph
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor surge of 1–2 ft possible in lower Chesapeake Bay and adjacent Atlantic beaches
weather_observation.rainfall: 3–5 inches possible with locally higher amounts causing flash-flood potential
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf, dangerous rip currents, and short-period heavy seas that can disrupt vessel traffic
